titleStmt.title: Letter, W. G. Brownlow in Knoxville, Tenn., to F. S. Heiskell in Knox County, Tenn., 1849 Sept. 18

bibl.title: Letter, W. G. Brownlow in Knoxville, Tenn., to F. S. Heiskell in Knox County, Tenn., 1849 Sept. 18

projectDesc.p: Machine-readable transcription created for the University of Tennessee Libraries Special Collections.

editorialDecl.p: Errors in transcription of the printed text not controlled.
Editorial tags limited to gap and unclear.
Catchwords and directional notes such as "turn page over" have been omitted.

revisionDesc.change: Approximate date of original transcription and transcriber.
Migrating from P4 to validated TEI P5.

div.p: Dear Sir - I send the bearer, John W. OBrien to you, to see if some money has come to your address, at Campbell's Station, for my use, and which is to meet a note sent out to the Union Bank for collection, and which is just due, this being the last of the three days of grace. I need not explain, as I presume you to understand it, by letters sent you. The object is not let it be known where the money is from. I fyou have not recived it, it will certainly come today, to the Station, and Mr. OBrien will go after your mail, with you oran, and return by your horse.
I have been five days comfrised to my bed with a hillions attack; and am not able to get about yet.
